org.sensorhub.impl.persistence.perst

Class BasicStorageImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sensorhub.impl.module.AbstractModule<BasicStorageConfig>
      • org.sensorhub.impl.persistence.perst.BasicStorageImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventProducer, IModule<BasicStorageConfig>, IBasicStorage, IRecordStorageModule<BasicStorageConfig>, IStorageModule<BasicStorageConfig>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ObsStorageImpl

    public class BasicStorageImpl
extends AbstractModule<BasicStorageConfig>
implements IRecordStorageModule<BasicStorageConfig>

    PERST implementation of IBasicStorage for storing simple data records.

    Since:
    Nov 15, 2014
    Author:
    Alex Robin

      int getNumMatchingRecords(IDataFilter filter, long maxCount)
      Computes the (potentially approximate) number of records matching the given filter.
      Since the returned value can be approximate and the number of matching records can change before or even during the actual call to IBasicStorage.getRecordIterator(IDataFilter), the exact number of records can only be obtained by counting the records returned by the iterator next() function.

      void start()
      Starts the module synchronously with the current configuration.
      Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully started or send an exception.
      Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
      init() should always be called before start().
      void stop()
      Stops the module.
      All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
      Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully stopped or send an exception.
      Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
      stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Starts the module synchronously with the current configuration.
        Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully started or send an exception.
        Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
        init() should always be called before start().
        Specified by:
        start in interface IModule<BasicStorageConfig>
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws SensorHubException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Stops the module.
        All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
        Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully stopped or send an exception.
        Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
        stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IModule<BasicStorageConfig>
        Throws:
        SensorHubException

        Description copied from interface: IBasicStorage
        Retrieves time range spanned by all records of the specified type
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        recordType - name of record type
        Returns:
        array of length 2 in the form [minTime maxTime] or [NaN NaN] if no records of this type are available

      • getRecordsTimeClusters

        public Iterator<double[]> getRecordsTimeClusters(String recordType)
        Description copied from interface: IBasicStorage
        Retrieves time boundaries of data clusters (i.e. this allows to detect temporal holes in the data)
        Specified by:
        getRecordsTimeClusters in interface IBasicStorage
        Parameters:
        recordType - name of record type
        Returns:
        A read-only iterator among time periods delimiting clusters of data

      • getNumMatchingRecords

        public int getNumMatchingRecords(IDataFilter filter,
                        long maxCount)
        Description copied from interface: IBasicStorage
        Computes the (potentially approximate) number of records matching the given filter.
        Since the returned value can be approximate and the number of matching records can change before or even during the actual call to IBasicStorage.getRecordIterator(IDataFilter), the exact number of records can only be obtained by counting the records returned by the iterator next() function.
        Specified by:
        getNumMatchingRecords in interface IBasicStorage
        Parameters:
        filter - filtering parameters
        maxCount - counting will stop once this threshold is reached
        Returns:
        number of matching records
